CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 7, 1957, pg. 24, reads: "Courier Hosts Newsboys at Annual Picnic - Outing For Newsies - Nearly 200 newsboys and girls spent the entire day at South Park's Sully's Pool and Grove as guests of The Pittsburgh Courier at the annual Newsboys Picnic on Aug. 30. The picnic, a circulation-promotion project, under the supervision of A.D. (Jake) Gaither, circulation manager; William Clyde Page, promotion manager, and William G. Nunn Sr., coordinator, was acclaimed a huge success.  Assisting the aforementioned were Leroy Randalll [sic], Carl Davis, Lloyd Tobias, and Donald Williams, distributors, who were mainly responsible for the large turnout.  James D. Drake, promotion art director, acted as co-chairman of the program activities, along with Mr. Davis.  Others who volunteered their services as attendants were Mrs. Bernice Price, Mrs. Lloyd Tobias, Miss Valerie Stewart and Minister Robert X. Davenport of Muhammad Temple of Islam No. 24.  Plenty of good food, baseball, volleyball, and football games, assorted foot races, swimming and rock and roll music kept the newsboys and girls busy throughout the day.  Pictured above are (1) Mr. Drake giving instructions to the selected groups prior to the race games, with Mr. Page, extreme right, assisting...Three large Pittsburgh Railways buses transported the newsboys and girls to and from the park. - Photos by Harris."
TitMainTitle: James D.  Drake, instructing group of boys and girls on race games with William Clyde Page pointing on right, gathered in open field for Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper Newsboys Annual Picnic, South Park
